definition: to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
basin/flower pot/unit of volume equal to 12 斗[dou3] and 8 升[sheng1], approx 128 liters/CL:個|个[ge4]
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)

sentences.english: The rain fell in torrents, insomuch that the soldiers were often ankle-deep in water.
sentences.chinese: 大雨倾盆，因而士兵们时时需涉水而行。

sentences.english: The pelting rain soaked his clothes.
sentences.chinese: 倾盆大雨淋透了他的衣服。

sentences.english: Festivities were undeterred by the heavy downpour.
sentences.chinese: 欢庆活动在倾盆大雨下如期举行。

sentences.english: Even when it was raining heavily, he refused to carry an umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 即使大雨倾盆，他也总是拒绝带伞。

sentences.english: Rain opens up and douses the fire.
There they waited while the heavy rains fell.
sentences.chinese: 大雨倾盆之际，他们就在那儿等待着。

sentences.english: Sometimes a mist seemed to be falling, and sometimes there was a sudden downpour of heavy, slanting rain.
sentences.chinese: 一忽儿像是下大雾，突然间又下起倾盆大雨。

sentences.english: He met a drench of rain.
A heavy downpour caused the wall of his house to crumble.
sentences.chinese: 一天，一场倾盆大雨冲坏了他家的围墙。

sentences.english: A heavy rain sudden comes, so i have to take shelter at a porch.
sentences.chinese: 突然倾盆大雨，我只好在一个门廊处避一避。

sentences.english: We just started to lay out the picnic and the heavens opened.
sentences.chinese: 我们刚刚开始摆开时餐，天就下起倾盆大雨来了。

sentences.english: The southeast wind had not let up. Suddenly torrential rains came down, soaking everyone.
sentences.chinese: 忽然大雨倾盆，湿透衣甲。

sentences.english: A rare dry-season downpour produced the thundering runoff.
sentences.chinese: 一次非常干旱季节的倾盆大雨产生了雷鸣般的急流。

sentences.english: In the middle of the picnic it started to rain cats and dogs, and everybody got soaked.
sentences.chinese: 野餐进行中，突然大雨倾盆，每个人身上都湿透了。

sentences.english: The downpour transformed a local machinery factory into a huge pond.
sentences.chinese: 倾盆大雨将当地一个机械厂变成一个巨大的鱼塘。

sentences.english: and the rain is coming down, the lightning hits and there's thunder.

definition: a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
to cascade down/to flow in torrents/(fig.) outpouring (of emotions)
